fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38478].
  {panel}

On the header there is a create button:

- Click the create button.
- Press "Close" before the page selection area loads.
- Click the create button again.
- Page selection area never loads after this point in time. It just shows a spinner forever. A full page refresh is required for the "create" button to work again.

I have attached a screenshot of the page selection area when it is in the spinner state.

Latest Chrome on OSX.
fields.summary: On EAC, clicking the create button twice, the "page selection" area fails to load
Likes on this page just fail to load

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38457].
  {panel}

Not sure how long this has been broken for, but I recall having seen this a couple of times previously and not clicking what the problem was.

When you try to move a page and browse the tree, a broken image appears next to the page that you try to expand.

Upon inspection, it appears it's trying to load: https://extranet.atlassian.com/s/en_GB/5619/5a47992db52859e06621b430f6d8201fa3911c53.80/_/images/ddtree/black%20spinner/12.png which returns Page not found.

Also appears on space tools > reorder pages.

Might be a regression from when we implemented AUI spinners.
fields.summary: Spinner missing/broken from move dialog (browse)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38340].
  {panel}

For Confluence, when we add a new video through the Drag&Drop feature (in my example, .mp4 files) it will automatically convert the video inside the Multimedia macro. However, since the macro can expect some issues [such as this bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33678], it can affect on the video display.

This Improvement Request is to allow the users to have options to disable the auto conversion from Drag&Drop to Multimedia macro or give the users options to render it as a link or only the attachment in the page. 

A suggestion to achieve it could be to insert a new module which would disable the auto preview for Drag&Drop attachments or provide an additional option in the Drag&Drop loading menu, before inserting the video in the page.

A workaround is to add the video through the *Page Editor > Insert > Files and Images*, since this will not convert to the Multimedia.
fields.summary: Option to Disable Multimedia Macro for Drag&Drop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38339].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
The documentation for [Migrating from HSQLDB to MySQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF57/Migrating+from+HSQLDB+to+MySQL] instructs customers to use a tool that is no longer supported by Oracle, and the link to this tool redirects to their newer Workbench tool. The instructions that follow, if you try using Workbench don't seem to work (especially for 5.8 and above which uses the newer h2 database).

h4. Solution
Remove this page of the documentation. Customers can already migrate from HSQLDB to any supported database by following the instructions at [Migrating to Another Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+to+Another+Database].
fields.summary: Documentation for Migrating from HSQLDB to MySQL is out of date
Emoticons should be sortable in page properties report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38336].
  {panel}

Hi, 

i ask for a new feature. It simply a button location to change. 

I explain : 
if i scroll down a page and see that something is wrong on it, i must rescroll to top to click on modify button. I think it can be easier to make the button modify scrolling with the page. So if i decide to modify a simple thing, i click on modify, and it stays at my scrolling view.

Have a nice week end, Gilles Savary

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38324].
  {panel}

It would be good if the macro supported the:

1. //youtu.be/ short link. Even better would be the ability to select YouTube and add the video ID only.

2. Enabling and disabling of the &rel=0 parameter at the end of YouTube links.

3. Automatic insertion of the YouTube link with customized text, which would appear on PDF output where video doesn't display. For instance, in a PDF file, we'd see

h2. My super duper topic
Watch the video at: http://youtu.be/S90qFBTTgcE

In addition:
* Can you confirm the plugin uses the newer iFrame API to guarantee preference for HTML5 player, especially since Firefox disables Flash by default.
* I don't know if the 5.8.5 version supports the above. I only have access to 5.2.5.

Thanks
fields.summary: Widget connector macro improvements for YouTube

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38323].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As Described in:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-35285 

The Section Macro increases CPU load dramatically rendering text directly in the BODY of the Section, and In Confluence Cloud after 60 seconds of load will cause a Page Timeout to occur locking all users from accessing the page.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit page Page
# Add Section Macro
# Add large body of text to the Macro outside a Column macro
# Save

h3. Expected Results
# Text rendered in body of section macro

h3. Actual Results
Page will be locked and you will receive a Page unavailable screen and the System CPU will be pegged at 100% slowing down the entire system for 60 seconds, for each page load attempt.

No errors in the logs

h3.Workaround
Detailed Workaround can be located Here:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Section+Macro+causes+page+timeout
fields.summary: Section Macro Causes page Timeout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38312].
  {panel}

At present, Confluence has a feature whereby you can select some text on a page, click a JIRA icon and a Create Issue 'popover' appears. This is useful, but it is limited to creating top-level issues.

Our use case: as part of our development process, we write up proposed approaches to solve JIRA issues as pages in Confluence. Having done this, we then copy and paste the relevant sections of the text from Confluence to JIRA so we can create subtasks for each aspect as we work through the solution.

It would be great if we could do this using the Create Issue feature in Confluence, but it doesn't support subtasks.

So, the issue type menu could include subtask types, and when one is selected, an additional field could appear so the parent issue can be specified.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA subtasks to be created from Confluence
Service Desk Mail Handler with more than two required fields
Administrators warning upon reaching user limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38308].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Given that Confluence has an application link to JIRA using 2LOi authentication
And a JIRA issue is embedded in a Confluence page
And a Confluence user doesn't have permission to view the issue in JIRA
When this user views the Confluence page
Then an error is shown.

Since the error does not indicate which issue is embedded the user has no way to contact the correct JIRA project lead to request permissions for the JIRA project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the project key and issue ID in the error message.
fields.summary: When user does not have permissions to view a JIRA issue embedded via macro show the issue ID rather than an error.
It is not recorded whether the amount of RAM refers to either the total server memory or memory allocated to the JVM, while blank settings indicate that the information was not provided.

Create a interface that allows the user update CRM Data
Set "Attachment Maximum Size" in MBytes, not in Bytes
View page bookmarks in page information
Roadmap Planner - Add the Markers text to the top of the chart as well
Confluence Site Restore not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38294].
  {panel}

Customer feedback and data analysis for CONF-34326 indicates that the slowness of the Page Properties Report (PPR) can be attributed to the number of cells being rendered in the report, rather than (say) the number of pages being scanned for Page Property rows to include.

The update of the PPR in Confluence 5.8 to use CQL filtering when editing the macro parameters has alleviated the problem for some customers by reducing the number of rows, and hence the total number of cells, rendered - but other customers have use-cases where the user viewing the report needs to be able to perform the filtering themselves. Currently the only option for these cases is to render a large number of rows and let the user search for a value within the browser.

Adding the CQL filter field UI to the rendered PPR would allow _additional_ filtering (as opposed to replacing the configured filter) to be applied, reducing the need for a large row count to be specified in the report parameters.

However, if the rows would need filtering on output of the report (e.g. only show rows in an employee table where the Office value is "Sydney"), there will additional development required to get these values indexed.

Therefore, if you vote for this issue, please include a comment with the kind of filtering you would require!
fields.summary: Provide CQL filter UI in rendered Page Properties Report
Ability to add customize columns in Task Report Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38286].
  {panel}

If you embed a contributors macro in a template then hit preview, you get this error message:
!https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/383n3v1B1p2E360n280n/Image%202015-07-15%20at%204.06.02%20pm.png!

Makes you think this doesn't work, but it does work, after you save the template and use it.

We should update this message to say something like "This macro cannot be previewed in a template, please save this template to preview the macro."
fields.summary: Improve the macro browser message when previewing the contributors macro in a template
Allow contributors macro to be used on product requirements blueprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38281].
  {panel}

We're still at v5.1.2, but in case this hasn't been changed in later versions:

Currently the PDF export filename uses the date/time format "DDMMYY-hhmm". Recommend changing this to an ISO 8601 format instead such as "YYYYMMDD-hhmm" for several reasons:
* it's the standard
* removes ambiguity, e.g. 140515-1415-023
* allows sequential ordering of filenames on file systems etc.

Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#General_principles
fields.summary: PDF export filename uses non-ISO 8601 format
Pagetree macro shows other spaces, but they don't work
The functionality of Formatting the A-Z section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38272].
  {panel}

https://maven.atlassian.com/content/repositories/atlassian-public/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/confluence-file-notifications/1.1.9/

Adaptavist is trying to access the source code for the confluence-file-notifications plugin.  From what I'm hearing, this should be accessible at the above link.

Can we make this public or moved to BitBucket so that Adaptavist can work on the source?  They'd like to fix a bug in the plugin.

Alternatively, can we simply provide the customer with a zip of the plugin source? The source also appears to be available here: https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence-file-notifications/browse
fields.summary: Confluence File Notifications plugin source should be public

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38271].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Fields made required through the use of workflow validators cannot be filled in using the Jira Issues Macro form, therefore the JIRA issue cannot be created. Similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23424 but different in that this corresponds to the making fields required through the user of validators.

h3. Steps to Replicate 
# On the JIRA side, go to a project workflow and edit it
# Select the 'Create' transition
# Select the Validators option
# Click 'Add validator'
# Select the 'Fields Required' option
# Select a system field (e.g. labels)
# publish workflow
# try to add issue through JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence
# Label field cannot be filled out because it is not listed

h3. Workaround
Create the issue directly in JIRA
fields.summary: The form provided when creating new issue with JIRA Issues macro should provide a form that contains fields made required through workflow validators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38257].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
XML-RPC call is triggered by accessing Confluence Manage Add-ons page from loopback, in some cases triggering the notification popup message for the SOAP and XML-RPC deprecation in the UI, causing confusion

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 5.9.0-OD-58-008

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Access Manage Add-ons
- https://<Base URL>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm#manage

h3. Expected Results
No XML-RPC Call triggered

h3. Actual Results
the System Plugin:
- Confluence Blogging RPC Plugin

Triggers a XML-RPC Call
The below exception is thrown in the apache access.log file:
{code}
127.0.0.1 - - [25/Jun/2015:09:42:45 -0600] "POST /wiki/rpc/xmlrpc HTTP/1.1" 200 8228 19869 "-" "Jakarta Commons-HttpClient/3.1"
165.254.226.226 216.51.95.40 - [06/Jul/2015:14:29:58 -0600] "GET /wiki/rest/plugins/1.0/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.xmlrpc.bloggingrpc-key/media/plugin-icon HTTP/1.0" 200 696 2236568 "https://<BASE URL>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/manage/all" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.10; rv:37.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/37.0"
{code}
 
h3. Notes
if page is accesses or refreshed enough times in a 30 day window it will trigger the Pop-up notification for SOAP and XML-RPC deprecation as noted here:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/SOAP+and+XML-RPC+removal+in+JIRA+Cloud

h3.Workaround
Atlassian Support can Disable the notification upon request, file a support case at: https://support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: XML-RPC call triggered by Confluence Manage add-ons
Plans to remove the documentation theme
Plans to remove status updates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38248].
  {panel}

The dashboard "Popular" tab is intended to show the content that has gained attention - likes, comments, etc. Content which has a lot of interaction is pushed to the top, and the top 3 goes out in "recommended content" emails.

With the new "Inline Comments" feature, this model is not quite working in the same way. A page which is a "work-in-progress" is likely to get a lot of inline comments as different people review and contribute. Each piece of feedback is counted as a single "comment". This does not mean that the page is popular, and it may not yet be ready for sharing more widely.

As pages are open by default, this means that unfinished drafts can start appearing as the most popular content items, above the actual published blog posts which have fewer comments overall.

I suggest that inline comments should be weighted differently from regular comments to avoid this.
fields.summary: Reduce or remove weighting of inline comments in the "Popular" tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38246].
  {panel}

Since Confluence 5.5 it is deprecated to store files in a database, leaving filesystem storage the only option left.
How about adding support for S3 and/or Swift object storage to store attachments and files ?

Using object storage as a file backend would simplify the following tasks:
* backup (storage is already replicated)
* multiple versions
* scalability (both storage space and load)
fields.summary: Add support for object storage backend

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38243].
  {panel}

h4. Purpose
When installing the Atlassian SDK, a user is informed that it cannot be opened because it is from an unidentified developer. This forces developers to go through the extra and unnecessary step of going to the OS System Preferences > Security and click the Open button presented there.
!unsigned.png!

h4. Solution
Sign the installer with a valid Developer-ID as described at https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/AppDistributionGuide/DistributingApplicationsOutside/DistributingApplicationsOutside.html
fields.summary: Sign the Atlassian SDK OSX installer with a valid Developer-ID
Ability to print or export Inline Comments

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

This one needs to go to in the header for this:
<link rel="icon" sizes="any" mask href="website_icon.svg">

As described here: 
https://developer.apple.com/library/prerelease/ios/releasenotes/General/WhatsNewInSafari/Articles/Safari_9.html

To make confluence pages display an icon when pinned: 
!pin.jpg!
fields.summary: Consider supporting the pin icon in Safari 9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38238].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Computable Document Format (.cdf) is a proprietary interactive document format from [Wolfram Alpha|https://www.wolfram.com/cdf/].
There is currently no way to embed this in Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a macro to support embedding this format.
 
h3. Workaround 
- Wolfram Alpha discusses [how to create a script to embed the file|http://blog.wolfram.com/2012/02/22/mathematica-qa-series-cdf-embedding-in-a-nutshell/]
- Use the [HTML macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/HTML+Macro] to display a page that has embedded the file, using [iFrame in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+put+an+IFrame+into+Confluence]
- No Workaround for Confluence Cloud
fields.summary: Support Computable Document Format (.cdf) as embedded macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38237].
  {panel}

This is reproducible on confluence.atlassian.com - the attached Word document has been generated from there.

Doing a {{head}} on the file results in the following:

{quote}
Message-ID: <1657636268.3573.1436525934483.JavaMail.svc_confluence_prod@node471.prod.inf.atlassian.com>
Subject: Exported From Confluence
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/related; 
	boundary="----=_Part_3572_816584643.1436525934481"

------=_Part_3572_816584643.1436525934481
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Location: file:///C:/exported.html
{quote}

Basically what is going on is that this is a multi-part email which Microsoft Word is able to display. It is not a real binary .doc file which can be opened by other tools which can open Word documents.
fields.summary: "Export to Word" results in '.doc' files which cannot be opened by iOS, Preview or Pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38218].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a Space Permission 
# Update the Space Permission by adding sysadmin in Individual Users
# Save the Changes

Getting the error: {{Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request}}
!token error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Behaviour
* Should be able to save the changes without errors.

h3. Actual Behaviour
* When a user edit a Space Permission and update the information, saving the changes will give an error: 
_Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page._

h3. Workaround
Use another browser, such as Chrome or Firefox
fields.summary: Getting security token error in Internet Explorer 11 when saving changes in Space Permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38216].
  {panel}

h2. Symptom

Table of Contents macro also displays other page's information if rendered by Blog Posts macro with 'entire' on 'Content Type to Display' option.

h2. Expected Result

Table of Contents macro displays the information of its own page only.

h2. Step to Reproduce

# Create multiple blog posts which contain Table of Contents macro
# Create a page which contain Blog Posts macro, selecting 'entire' on 'Content Type to Display' option
# You will see the Table of Contents macro displays other page's information also (See attached TheProblem.jpg).
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro also displays other page's information if rendered by Blog Posts macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38209].
  {panel}

I often have meetings relating to this or that JIRA Task, Story, Epic, etc.,  I keep track of the meeting and follow-ups in Confluence, creating Confluence tasks as I go.  Often these tasks relate directly to a JIRA ticket.  It would be very convenient to have an easy way to view all Confluence tasks that relate to this or that JIRA ticket within said ticket (rather than creating a link manually in the Confluence document, and then clicking on the resulting link in JIRA to see if there were any tasks that relate to the JIRA ticket).

Maybe this could involve a specialized Confluence Macro, identifying a JIRA ticket that will display all the tasks in the Confluence page (with the ability to check said tasks in the JIRA ticket), as well as link type in JIRA that would identify individual Confluence records whose tasks will be brought into the JIRA ticket.

Finally, it would be good to have a separate area for Confluence tasks within the JIRA ticket - maybe something like the areas for the lists of linked tickets and sub-tasks that are currently found in JIRA tickets.

I created a ticket in the JIRA project for this functionality -  [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44195] for this functionality.

Thanks,

Daniel.
fields.summary: Allow for the inclusion of Confluence Tasks in JIRA Tickets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38208].
  {panel}

I use the Create from Template Macro extensively - especially for the creation of meeting minutes that relate to specific projects or project groups.  

The only difference between the minutes document would be the labels I would want to associate with the minutes (different projects would have different labels, which will then allow me to easily track and aggregate the meeting records).  The creation of a separate template for each label feels wasteful and convoluted, as well as being an administrative overhead, as regular users cannot create templates that can be accessed by other users.

On the  other hand, users can add the Create from Template Macro button to any Confluence page they author or edit, and having labels generated automatically once a record is created - based on a configuration in the Macro itself will provide:

1. Flexibility (creating a variation in the same template by allowing it to be created with different labels).
2. Prevention of mistakes and missed information - Currently I need to put in the label (sometimes multiple labels) after the document is saved.  I may forget to do it, and so the document may fail to appear where it is supposed to because of the missing label.

Thanks,

Daniel.
fields.summary: Allow labels as parameters in the Create from Template Macro
As an admin I'd like to add the '//' from Meeting Notes on Team Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38204].
  {panel}

I have cloned this Ticket from [CONF-28476|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28476] because I think it was closed without ever being solved. I think the importance of this is significant to the usefulness of the product:
* For example: Be able to reproducibly assign people to many tasks in a confluence task or checklist just by filling in a few fields

Merely using the instructional text does not allow for the ability to auto populate  an entire template if the mention happens many times in something like tasks.

Also, dates should also be able to be used in template variables.

From old ticket:
It is currently not possible to @mention someone in a template variable. Allowing this could improve uptake of Confluence for new customers, by increasing visibility of Confluence in the business.
fields.summary: Allow @mentions in template variables

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38181].
{panel}
 
h3. Summary
If you have a page template with labels, the labels are not copied into the new page created from the template.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a template (can be global or space template)
 # Set a label
 # Save it
 # Create a page using that template

h3. Expected Results

The new page should have the custom label.
h3. Actual Results

The page doesn't have the custom label.
h3. Workaround

There's none besides setting the label directly in the new page.
fields.summary: Labels are not copied from Page Templates
Remove Console / Log Message When Stopping Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38169].
  {panel}

h3. Background

Confluence allow administrators to control some of the content of workbox notifications for example, integrated application notification such as JIRA. However this option is not provided for the users.

For example, some users such as developer team might relies heavily on JIRA notification, but other department might not. Hence JIRA notification could hinder these users to see the important notification.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide workbox notification configuration menu in "User Profile" similar to "Email" notification configuration which is available now.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to control which notification will be shown in my workbox
Link autocompletion should work when designating link text with pipe character
Images fit to width
Exception rendered on page: https://developer.atlassian.com/display/HOME/Atlassian+REST+API+policy
Get experiment of Confluence in JIRA view to be ready to run

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38146].
  {panel}

At the moment, there is no way to add nor to remove team members from a team space blueprint

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new team space blueprint
# Click on *Space Tools* > *Permission*
# Click on Edit permission
# Add or remove user from the list.
# Go to team space page. The user is not added to the team space nor removed.

*Expected Behaviour*
User is added in the team space automagically.

*Workaround*
Need to do it manually. Add another row or column to the table with the Profile picture macro and then add mailto-link macro below the profile picture.
fields.summary: Allow user to add or remove team members from a team space
Pin the Edit button to the top when scrolling wiki pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38144].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer is migrating and would like to export a list of Add-ons and Plug-ins that were installed in the old environment to ensure the new instance has the same ones installed

h3. Suggested Solution
An option to Export to Excel, CSV, Text, etc a list of all installed Add-ons/Plug-ins in an Instance
 
h3. Workaround 
View *Manage Add-ons* page (!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/444107050/cog.png! > Add-ons)
fields.summary: Export a List of All Installed Add-ons

fields.description:

h3. Current behaviour

When a page has many inline comments, it may be hard to read the content of the page with so many highlighted text.
